Utilities for paths.

Method Detail

newPath

public static Path newPath(Iterable<Path> paths)
Returns a path that represents the concatenation of the specified paths.

Parameters:
paths - the paths to concatenate into a single path
Returns:
a path that represents the concatenation of the specified paths
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if any two subsequent paths are not consequtive (i.e. the tail of the first does not match the head of the second), or if no path at all is given

findPath

public static Path findPath(InspectableGraph graph,
                            Node start,
                            Node target,
                            Direction direction)
Finds a directed path from a node to another, in a given graph.

Parameters:
graph - the graph into which the path is to be searched
start - the node to start from
target - the node to find
the - allowable direction of edges to follow while searching for a path
Returns:
a path from start node to target node, or null if no such path exists. If multiple paths exist, an arbitrary path of them is returned
